Ormas di Bekasi Minta Jatah Kelola Parkir di Minimarket, Rahmat Effendi Menjawab
06 Nov 2019, 00:41 by Riesty Yusnilaningsih
BEKASI, (PR).- Wali Kota Bekasi Rahmat Effendi menyatakan, pelibatan ormas (organisasi masyarakat) dalam menarik retribusi parkir di minimarket merupakan salah satu upaya memberdayakan sumber daya manusia melalui lapangan kerja informal.
"Pada dasarnya, tidak hanya ormas. Semua lini punya hak yang sama. Siapa yang berminat, nantinya dibekali surat tugas dengan masa berlaku tertentu. Jika masa berlaku habis, tidak boleh disalahgunakan," kata Rahmat Effendi, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Pernyataan tersebut disampaikan Rahmat Effendi sebagai jawaban atas viralnya video desakan ormas yang ingin mengelola parkir di seluruh minimarket di Kota Bekasi.
Dalam video berdurasi delapan menit itu, terlihat Kepala Badan Pendapatan Daerah Kota Bekasi Aan Suhanda yang menyetujui keinginan ormas mengelola parkir di minimarket.
Video tersebut menyebar melalui aplikasi percakapan dan media sosial, lengkap dengan narasi yang menyebut bahwa Kota Bekasi mendukung ormas menjadi pemeras pengusaha ritel.
Demi kas daerah
Rahmat mengatakan, Pemkot Bekasi memang tengah menggali potensi pemasukan untuk mengisi kas daerah. Termasuk pula pada 606 minimarket yang bertebaran di seluruh wilayah.
"Menggali ke dalam minimarketnya, tentu tidak mungkin karena pemiliknya telah mengurus perizinan usahanya. Lahan minimarketnya pun tentu sudah dibayarkan pajaknya. Lalu yang memungkinkan ialah parkirnya," katanya.
Perihal parkir, Rahmat Effendi menyebut bahwa ketentuan aturannya sudah jelas yakni Undang-Undang Nomor 28 Tahun 2009 Tentang Pajak Daerah dan Retribusi Daerah.
Demi mendapatkan pemasukan dari potensi parkir, pemerintah menempuh sejumlah skema kerja sama, seperti parkir di pusat perbelanjaan dan di badan jalan.
"Sesuai ketentuan, semua pemasukan parkir yang terhimpun harus disetorkan kepada kas daerah pada hari yang sama. Ini merupakan upaya menggali potensi pemasukan kas daerah sekaligus memperkerjakan sumber daya manusia di sektor informal melalui cara yang dibenarkan aturan yang berlaku," katanya.
Minimarket tak memungut parkir
Corporate Communication PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Reza Pahlevi selaku perwakilan pengusaha ritel dan minimarket mengatakan, sejak awal, pihaknya tidak pernah menentukan tarif parkir di seluruh titik gerai Alfamart.
Meski demikian, di beberapa titik gerai, pengurus RT/RW, ormas, serta perseorangan meminta izin untuk mengelola parkir.
“Aslinya, kami tidak pernah mengutip uang parkir di seluruh gerai yang ada,” katanya.
Reza mengatakan, pihaknya sudah mengetahui adanya upaya pemerintah untuk memaksimalkan potensi pendapatan daerah dengan cara mengelola parkir di seluruh gerai toko retail. Namun, manajemen minimarket tidak pernah menyatakan mendukung atau menolak.
“Bagi kami, siapa saja yang mengelola, selama tidak pasang muka seram, nongkrong di salah satu gerai, membuat calon pembeli takut, dan tidak jadi membeli, hal itu boleh saja,” katanya.***

CBOs in Bekasi Ask for Allotment to Manage Parking in Minimarket, Rahmat Effendi Answered
06 Nov 2019, 00:41 by Riesty Yusnilaningsih
BEKASI, (PR) .- Bekasi Mayor Rahmat Effendi stated, the involvement of mass organizations (community organizations) in attracting parking fees in minimarkets is one of the efforts to empower human resources through informal employment.
"Basically, not only mass organizations. All lines have the same rights. Who is interested, will be equipped with a letter of assignment with a certain validity period. If the validity period expires, it should not be misused," Rahmat Effendi said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
The statement was delivered by Rahmat Effendi in response to the viral video urging CSOs who want to manage parking in all minimarkets in Bekasi.
In the eight-minute video, we can see the Head of the Bekasi City Revenue Agency Aan Suhanda who agreed to the organization's desire to manage parking in the minimarket.
The video is spread through conversation and social media applications, complete with narratives that say that Bekasi City supports mass organizations to exploit retail entrepreneurs.
For the sake of regional treasury
Rahmat said that the Bekasi City Government was indeed exploring the potential for revenue to replenish the regional treasury. Also included are 606 minimarkets scattered throughout the region.
"Digging into the minimarket is certainly not possible because the owner has taken care of business licensing. The minimarket has also been paid tax. Then what is possible is parking," he said.
Regarding parking, Rahmat Effendi said that the provisions of the rules were clear, namely Law No. 28/2009 concerning Regional Taxes and Regional Retribution.
For the sake of earning revenue from parking potentials, the government is pursuing a number of cooperation schemes, such as parking in shopping centers and on road bodies.
"In accordance with the provisions, all parking revenues collected must be deposited to the local treasury on the same day. This is an effort to explore the potential of regional cash income while employing human resources in the informal sector through the justified way of applicable regulations," he said.
Minimarkets do not collect parking
Corporate Communication of PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Reza Pahlevi as a representative of retail and minimarket businessmen said, from the beginning, it had never determined parking rates at all Alfamart outlets.
However, in several outlets, RT / RW management, mass organizations, and individuals requested permission to manage parking.
"Originally, we never quoted parking money in all the existing outlets," he said.
Reza said, his party was aware of the government's efforts to maximize regional income potential by managing parking in all retail store outlets. However, minimarket management has never stated support or refuse.
"For us, anyone who manages, as long as they do not put on a scary face, hang out in one of the outlets, make potential buyers afraid, and not be buying, that's OK," he said. ***
